page.title: 06TRANSPORT IN CHINGFORD
page.content: The railway runs to Chingford from Liverpool St.A long time ago there were steam engines but now there are electric trains.This station was opened in 1878,but this wasn't the original station.The line was going to High Beach(in Epping Forest)but was never finished.Chingford grew when the railway arrived and it is very busy with people going to London to work. People used to come out of London on the train to go to Epping Forest. There are alot of sidings for commuter trains but no goods trains. Next to the railway station is the bus station which is also a terminus. The buses which go from this terminus are;-97 to Leyton.97a to Hackney.212 to Yardley Lane Estate.102 to Golders Green.179 to Barking.313 to Potters Bar Garage.145 to Dagenham.
